item.description:
Metrorock Everett is hosting their second Annual Climb for a Cure, benefitting cancer research. Last year that meant climbing routes to accumulate vertical feet. Some people clocked in over 1500 vertical feet in a four-five hour climbing session and had donors matching the vertical feet climbed with corresponding dollars. A true test of endurance.

Please see the announcement below from Bill Schifone, to sign up just email him at schifone1@verizon.net:


CLIMB FOR A CURE II
Sponsored by the friends and families of MetroRock
1.) EVENT – “CLIMB FOR A CURE” a Jimmy Fund Sponsored Event
a. “Climb New England’s Indoor Cannon Cliff”
b. PLACE: MetroRock, Everett
c. DATE: April 24, 2010
d. TIME: 4 PM to 10 PM
e. WHAT IT IS: fundraiser to benefit the Jimmy Fund and Dana Farber in their fight against childhood cancer
f. GOAL: raise $10,000
2.) PARTICIPATION
a. Registration is now open
i. To register participants should email Bill Schifone at Bill@metrorock.com or by picking up a pledge sheet from the front desk or MetroRock
ii. A MetroRock Jimmy Fund Pledge Sheet will be given/sent to you upon registration.
1. This must be completed by every participant
2. It must be turned in before or on the day of the comp
3. It must have the participants name on it
4. It must have all the pledges’ names and the amount of the pledges
b. Sponsored climbers will attempt to climb 600 vertical feet on April 25th from 4pm to 10pm
i. Open to any climber
ii. Must be already in MetroRock’s data base having passed a belay test OR
iii. Must be able to pass a belay test
c. Registration closing on Friday, April 23rd, 2010
i. Climbers showing up on the 24th will be allowed to climb for a nominal $25 fee which will go 100% toward the fundraiser
d. Our goal is to have 100 participants that each collects at least $100 in pledges.
3.) PLEDGES
a. Sponsored climbers are encouraged to solicit pledges from private individuals or businesses.
i. Pledges must be collected in cash or checks
ii. Checks must be made out to the Jimmy Fund
b. All pledges MUST be recorded on a Metrorock Jimmy Fund Pledge Sheet
c. Pledge Sheets must be turned in on or before April 24th.
d. Sponsored Climbers can attain one of three levels of sponsorship
i. Gold - $250 or more in total pledges
ii. Silver - $100 or more in total pledges
iii. Bronze - $50 or more in total pledges
e. MetroRock will reward sponsored climbers based on COLLECTED pledges with associated Metrobucks (good for anything including merchandise in the gym) as follows:
i. Gold - $25 Metrobucks
ii. Silver - $10 Metrobucks
iii. Bronze - $5 Metrobucks
f. The Metrobucks will be one aspect of MetroRock’s contribution to the receiving organization. The benefit of this is that MetroRock can declare the retail value of merchandise/services without that outflow of cash.
4.) EVENT LOGISTICS
a. Gym will be closed to general public for event hours, thus it will be OPEN up to 4PM and all normal morning lessons/parties etc. will carry on as usual
b. Two methods of ‘scoring’; donations will be based on feet climbed however.
i. Based purely on vertical feet climbed
1. Gym routes will be given a ‘value’ of 35 feet for each route, meaning a participant will have to climb 17 routes to attain the 600 foot goal. This is not an easy task regardless of grade.
2. Routes can be done toprope or lead. No premium/penalty for grades
ii. Based on vertical feet and grade
1. Point system – combines grade and vertical feet. I will post this on all (or many of) the climbs in the gym at the time of the event.
2. This will make it more interesting for the competitors, especially those that are experienced climbers
iii. Routes do not have to be linked; I.E. the climber can rest on the rope
iv. Boulder problems – bouldering will be allowed. A donation of $25 will be requested on the day of the event.
c. Climbers will be given a ‘scorecard’ to keep track of their climbs. There will be a place for a peer’s initials (only one). I will generate those in a separate file. Participant will chose which type of score sheet they want. The scoresheet based on points will also have a column for vertical feet too.
d. MetroRock will provide food and beverage for the participating climbers either a pizza party or a barbecue starting at 6 PM.
e. Walk ins on day of event (people will invariably forget that we’re closed and come)
i. ALL roped climbers, members and non-members, unaware of the event and simply coming to climb will be asked for a nominal donation of $25 and will be able to climb.
ii. ALL boulderers, members and non-members, unaware of the event and just coming to climb will be asked for a nominal donation of $25 and will be able to climb
